article.topic: SEO Content Formula for Page 1 Rankings (Search Intent + Diverse Topical Angle)
article.writingAngle: Query Fan-Out 实操指南 - Focus on tools and methods: how to systematically discover diverse angles

company.name: Semrush
company.coreBusiness: Semrush provides a comprehensive software platform for digital marketing professionals, offering tools for search engine optimization, paid advertising analysis, content marketing, competitive intelligence, and social media management.
company.valueProposition: An all-in-one digital marketing platform that enables marketers to analyze competitors, track search rankings, audit websites, and optimize content across multiple marketing channels. The unified Semrush One platform integrates multiple toolkits for comprehensive marketing management.

audience.description: Marketing managers, small business owners with some experience, content managers, startup founders
audience.industry: Marketing managers, small business owners with some experience, content managers, startup founders

goals.primary: Improve marketing results; select right tools; understand competitive landscape; justify marketing investments
secondary: Understand best practices for specific situations

alreadyKnows: Basic SEO and digital marketing concepts
needsToLearn: How to compare and select marketing tools
How to interpret and act on data
Best practices for their specific situation

writingApproach.complexity: Moderate; can use industry terms with brief clarification
writingApproach.structure: Problem-solution format; comparison tables; numbered lists

do: Provide decision frameworks: 'When choosing between tools, consider these factors...'
Use comparison tables for quick evaluation
Offer concrete recommendations: 'For blogs targeting long-tail keywords...'
Connect tactics to business outcomes (traffic, leads, revenue)
dont: Over-explain basic concepts they already know
Present options without recommendations or guidance

userContext.situation: They've noticed Google's SERPs now show diverse content angles instead of 10 similar articles. They want to understand this shift and learn how to create content that ranks by finding unique angles.
userContext.currentState: They understand basic SEO and keyword research, but are stuck creating 'me-too' content that competes head-on with existing results. They may have heard terms like 'query fan-out' or 'perspective diversity' but don't know how to systematically apply these concepts.
userContext.desiredState: After reading, they can use specific tools and methods to discover untapped content angles that satisfy search intent while differentiating from existing SERP results.

searchIntent.coreQuestion: How do I systematically discover diverse content angles using query fan-out that satisfy search intent AND differentiate from existing SERP results?
implicitQuestions: What tools can I use to find query fan-out opportunities?
How do I validate that an angle still satisfies user intent?
What does 'perspective diversity' mean in practice for content creation?
How do I analyze existing SERPs to find angle gaps?
What's the step-by-step process for applying this formula?
searchIntent.successCriteria: Reader can independently use query fan-out tools and methods to identify 3-5 unique content angles for any given keyword that haven't been covered in existing SERPs but still match user intent.

goldenInsights.insight: Don't chase fan-out queries—own the topic (Surfer SEO recommendation)
AI visitors are 4.4x more valuable than organic visitors based on conversion rate
76.4% of ChatGPT most-cited pages were updated in last 30 days
Topical authority is the #1 on-page ranking factor (Surfer study)

differentiation.primaryDifferentiator: Practical workflow connecting query fan-out to content angle discovery, backed by Surfer 173,902 URL study and counter-intuitive 'own the topic' strategy

irreplicableInsights.insight: 161% higher citation rate for pages ranking on fan-out queries (173,902 URLs studied)
Don't chase fan-out queries—own the topic instead
Semrush experiment: 150% citation increase but volatile - realistic expectations

avoidList: Generic 5-step optimization lists without specific tool guidance
Focusing only on AI optimization without connecting to traditional SERP analysis

data: Platform-specific optimization differences (ChatGPT vs Google AI Mode vs Perplexity)

controversies: Chase fan-out queries vs own the topic - research supports owning topic
Long-form vs short-form content - context matters more than length
research.coreThesis: The secret to ranking in AI-powered search isn't chasing fan-out queries individually—it's building comprehensive topical authority that naturally answers the full spectrum of user sub-intents

emphasize: Surfer study data (161% citation increase, 0.77 correlation)
Tool-specific guidance (Semrush AI Visibility, AlsoAsked, Content Gap tools)
differentiateWith: Counter-intuitive 'don't chase fan-out, own the topic' approach
Practical workflow connecting query fan-out to content angle discovery

hookUsed.content: 不要追逐 fan-out 查询——主导话题。这是 Surfer 分析 173,902 个 URL 后得出的核心结论。

differentiationApplied.primaryDifferentiatorUsed: 反直觉策略'主导话题而非追逐查询'作为文章核心论点，贯穿 Hook 和 H2-2

irreplicableInsightsUsed.insight: Don't chase fan-out queries—own the topic

avoidedPatterns: 没有使用泛泛的 5 步优化列表，而是提供 4 步具体工作流
每个工具都有具体功能说明和使用场景
明确提到结果的波动性，给出现实预期
differentiationApplied.titleDifferentiation: 标题直接使用反直觉洞见'不追逐 Fan-Out 查询，而是主导话题'，与竞品'什么是 Query Fan-Out'的定义式标题形成对比

opinionsIncluded: H2-1: 这改变了内容竞争的本质——从单关键词竞争变成话题覆盖竞争
H2-2: 不要为每个 fan-out 查询单独创建页面——这是低效的
H2-3: 从 PAA 开始是最快找到角度差异化的方法
H2-4: 建立内容更新节奏比一次性'完美'发布更重要
H2-5: 一个完整的话题集群 > 10 篇孤立的优化文章
